w:r.w:t: Teaching Guide
TITLE: Travel
T3 U1 L7
Lesson Description Text:

The teacher will teach vocabulary words associated with traveling. They will learn these words by using TPR, sentence frames, and vocabulary. Students will study these words and phrases: beach, mountains, savannah, rainforest, ocean, cruise, and I want to
go
Student Learning Objectives:
At the completion of this lesson, students will be able to:
Recognize, spell, and pronounce these target words associated with traveling
Spell and pronounce common associated words
Use these sets of words in complete sentences
Students will be able to describe where they want to go
Word List:
beach, mountains, savannah, rainforest, ocean, cruise, and I want to go
OPENER/GREETING SLIDES
Slide 1: Opener Slide
This slide will always be the
Naativ
-branded opener slide that the teacher will display as the student enters the classroom.
Slide 2:
Greet your student and introduce the lesson concept: “Today, we are going to be learning about traveling and expressing where you want to go.”
INSTRUCTION/ACTIVITY SLIDES
Slide Number 3
Student Actions/Output
Circle the target words.
Answer the teacher’s questions in complete sentences.
Teaching Tips
Have the students circle the word travel and
beach.
Explain to the students that traveling means going somewhere usually on vacation.
Ask the students: “Have you ever been to the beach?”
Ask the students: “Do you
like
or would you like to travel to the beach? Why?”
Slide Number 4
Student Actions/Output
Answer the teacher’s questions in complete sentences.
Teaching Tips
Explain to the students that there are lots of things they can do at the beach.
Ask the students: “What activities would you do at the beach?”
Ask the students: “Would you swim at the beach? Would you make a sand castle? Would you sun tan? Would you take
a boat ride? Would you like to go surfing?”
Slide Number 5
Student Actions/Output
Complete the sentence frame by filling in the blank on the slide
Teaching Tips
Ask the students: “If you traveled to the beach, what would you take with you?”
Ask the students: “Would you take a bathing suit with you to the beach? Why?”
Ask the students: “Would you take water with you to the beach? Why?”
Ask the students: “Would you take sunscreen with you to the beach? Why?”
Slide Number 6
Student Actions/Output
Circle the target word
Answer the teacher’s questions in complete sentences.
Teaching Tips
Have the students circle the word travel and
mountains.
Ask the students: “Have you ever been to the mountains?”
Ask the students: “Do you
like
or would you like to travel to the mountains? Why?”
Slide Number 7
Student Actions/Output
Complete the sentence frame by filling in the blank on the slide.
Teaching Tips
Explain to the students that there are lots of things they can do at the mountains.
Ask the students: “What activities would you do at the mountains?”
Ask the students: “Would you like to hike on the mountain? Would you like to ride your bike? Would you l
ike to ski or snowboard down the mountain?”
Slide Number 8
Student Actions/Output
Answer the teacher’s questions in complete sentences.
Teaching Tips
Ask the students: “If you traveled to the mountains, what would you take with you?”
Ask the students: “Would you take a backpack with you to the mountains? Why?”
Ask the students: “Would you take a tent and a sleeping back with you to the mountains? Why?”
Ask the students: “Would you take a bike with you to the mountains? Why?”
Slide Number 9
Student Actions/Output
Circle the target words.
Answer the teacher’s questions in complete sentences.
Teaching Tips
Have the students circle the word travel and
savannah.
Explain what the savannah is and ask them if they have ever heard of it before.
Ask the students: “Have you ever been to the savannah?”
Ask the students: “Do you
like
or would you like to travel to th
e savannah? Why?”
Slide Number 10
Student Actions/Output
Complete the sentence frame by filling in the blank on the slide.
Teaching Tips
Explain to the students that there are lots of things they can do at the savannah.
Ask the students: “What activities would you do at the savannah?”
Ask the students: “Would you like to see different animals? Would you like to go on a safari? What animals
would you like to see?”
Slide Number 11
Student Actions/Output
Answer the teacher’s questions in complete sentences.
Teaching Tips
Ask the students: “If you traveled to the savannah, what would you take with you?”
Ask the students: “Would you take binoculars with you? Why?”
Ask the students: “Would you take bug spray with you? Why?”
Ask the students: “Would you take a hat with you? Wh
Slide Number 12
Student Actions/Output
Circle the target words.
Answer the teacher’s questions in complete sentences.
Teaching Tips
Have the students circle the word travel and
rainforest.
Explain to the students what the rain forest is and ask them if they have ever heard of the rain forest.
Ask the students: “Do you
like
or would you like to travel to the rainforest? Why?”
Slide Number 13
Student Actions/Output
Complete the sentence frame by filling in the blank on the slide.
Teaching Tips
Explain to the students that there are lots of things they can do at the rainforest.
Ask the students: “What activities would you do at the rainforest?”
Ask the students: “Would you like to see different animals? Would you play in a waterfall?”
Slide Num
ber 14
Student Actions/Output
Answer the teacher’s questions in complete sentences.
Teaching Tips
Ask the students: “If you traveled to the rainforest, what would you take with you?”
Ask the students: “Would you take a map with you? Why?”
Ask the students: “Would you take running shoes with you? Why?”
Ask the students: “Would you take a camera with you? Why?”
Slide Number 15
Student Actions/Output
Circle the target words.
Answer the teacher’s questions in complete sentences.
Teaching Tips
Have the students circle the word travel and
cruise.
Explain to the students that a cruise is a large ship that takes you to many places. Explain that a cruise ship is also like a giant hotel.
Ask the students: “Have you ever been on a cruise? Would you like to go on a cruise? Why?”
Slide Number 16
Student Actions/Output
Complete the sentence frame by filling in the blank on the slide.
Teaching Tips
Explain to the students that there are lots of things they can do if they go on a cruise.
Ask the students: “What activities would you like to do on a cruise?”
Ask the students: “Would you like to swim with dolphins? Would you like to swim I the pool?”
Slide Number 17
Student Actions/Output
Answer the teacher’s questions in complete sentences.
Teaching Tips
Ask the students: “If you went on a cruise, what would you take with you?”
Ask the students: “Would you take sunglasses? Why?”
Ask the students: “Would you take your bathing suit? Why?”
Ask the students: “Would you take your luggage?” Why?”
Slide Number 18
Student Actions/Output
Fill in the missing letters.
Answer the teacher’s questions in complete sentences.
Teaching Tips
Have the students fill in the missing
letters.
Ask the students: “Which location would you take surfboard to?”
Ask the students: “Which location is colder than the other?”
Slide Number 19
Student Actions/Output
Fill in the missing letters.
Answer the teacher’s questions in complete sentences.
Teaching Tips
Have the students fill in the missing
letters.
Ask the students: “Which location is hotter?”
Ask the students: “Which location can you see a giraffe?”
Slide Number 20
Student Actions/Output
Fill in the missing letters.
Answer the teacher’s questions in complete sentences.
Teaching Tips
Have the students fill in the missing
letters.
Ask the students: “How is a cruise vacation similar to a vacation at the beach?”
CONVERSATION ACTIVITIES SLIDES – Slide 21
Freeform “Show and Tell” Conversation Activity Slide
Student Actions/Output
Draw a picture of where you would like to travel. Pick the beach, mountains, savannah, rainforest, or cruise.
Write the name of your vacation on the line below.
Answer the teacher’s questions in complete sentences.
Teaching Tips
Have the students pick where they would like to
travel.
Have them pick either the beach, the mountains, the savannah, the rainforest, or a cruise.
Have them write what they have chosen on the line below.
Ask the students: “Where would you like to travel?
Why did you pick that location? What would you do there?”
Word Wall Vocabulary Builder Activity – Slide 22
Student Actions/Output
Students will read and spell their new words: beach, mountains, savannah, rainforest, ocean, cruise, and I want to go
Teaching Tips
The teacher will give feedback on the spelling and pronunciation of the new words.
